titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Philip Brasher land tax receipt 1977.389
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:40:21 +0000.

did.abstract: One receipt for taxes paid on land by Philip Brasher, signed by the Comptroller of New York State and dated March 30, 1810.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Philip Brasher land tax receipt, 1977.389, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Philip Brasher (d. 1835) was a Brooklyn resident and a member of the New York State Assembly. An 1830 city directory indicates that Brasher lived at 128 Henry Street.

list.head: Sources:
list.item: Sterner, Connie Molnar. "Brasher Photos." Accessed July 5, 2011. http://www.brasher.northcountryny.com/

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One receipt for taxes paid on land by Philip Brasher, signed by the Comptroller of New York State and dated March 30, 1810.
